{{Infobox single | Name = Water | Cover = | Artist = [[The Who]] | from Album = | | A-side = "[[5.15]]" | Released = October 5, 1973http://www.thewho.com/index.php?module=discography&discography_item_id=52&discography_tag=singles | Format = [[Single (music)|7" single]] | Recorded = 1970 at Eel Pie Studios, London |Genre= [[Rock music|Rock]] | Length = | Label = [[Track Records]]/[[Music Corporation of America|MCA]] | Writer = [[Pete Townshend]] | Producer = Pete Townshend | Certification = | Last single = | This single = | Next single = | Misc = }} '''Water''' is a song by English rock band [[The Who]] originally appearing as the [[A-side and B-side|B-side]] to "5.15" in 1973, and again to the single "[[Love, Reign o'er Me]]." ==Lifehouse== ===Background=== After the success of [[Tommy (album)|Tommy]] in 1969, Pete Townshend began work on ''[[Lifehouse (rock opera)|Lifehouse]]''. For the first recordings, Pete produced several demos at his ''Eel Pie Studios'' which were related to "Lifehouse".''Who's Next'' 1995 Reissue Liner Notes ===Meaning=== It was during these sessions that "Water" was first recorded in the Spring of 1970.http://www.thewho.com/index.php?module=discography&discography_item_id=67&discography_tag=albums The plot in ''Lifehouse'' revolved around a totalitarian society without rock music. In this society, there is also rampant pollution which becomes a '''teenage wasteland'''. '''Water''' talks of the toughness of everyday life and how:
"They need water,
And maybe somebody's daughter."
==Live/Compilation Appearances== ===Live History=== "Water" was played by The Who from 1970 until 1971, including at the final show at the '''Young Vic''' on April 26, 1971.''Who's Next'' 1995 Reissue Liner Notes It made its first live appearance at the first show at the [[Metropolitan Opera House (Lincoln Center)|Metropolitan Opera House]] in New York on June 7, 1970. ===Album Appearances=== The following ''Who'' albums feature "Water": *''[[Who's Next]]'' (1995 Reissue & Deluxe Edition) *''[[Odds & Sods]]'' (1998 remastered CD) *''[[Rarities Volume I & Volume II]]'' *''[[Two's Missing]]'' *''[[The 1st Singles Box]]'' *''[[Live at the Isle of Wight Festival 1970 (album)|Live at the Isle of Wight Festival 1970]]'' ===Live Video/DVD Appearances=== *''[[Thirty Years of Maximum R&B Live]]'' (version of "Water" recorded at the [[Tanglewood Music Center|Tanglewood Music Shed]] on July 7, 1970) *''[[Live at the Isle of Wight Festival 1970 (film)|Live at the Isle of Wight Festival 1970]]'' (recorded on August 29, 1970) ==Citation== {{cleanup-link rot|date=August 2011}} {{The Who singles}} [[Category:The Who songs]] [[Category:B-side songs]] [[Category:1973 singles]] [[Category:Songs written by Pete Townshend]] [[Category:English-language songs]] [[es:Water (canciÃ³n)]] [[fr:Water (chanson)]]
